answerText: "A Country Doctor" [or "Ein Landarzt"][10] In this other story by the author of "A Country Doctor," the Officer is killed by his favorite machine, which was supposed to inscribe the words "Be Just" on his skin.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 15 | 4 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The last sentence of this story warns that "A false alarm on the night bell once answered...cannot be made good." For 10 points each: [10]  Name this story, whose title character lies to a dying boy about his wound and is guilt-ridden over having left his servant Rosa behind with a lecherous groom.
